instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: Screen compatibility for image testing purposes only on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
I'm trying to get a couple screens for testing purposes when troubleshooting back light or image problems only, I understand that the camera connectors vary but I also know that some screens can be used to test a few different models, I just don't know which ones are.

Any help will be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: Screen compatibility for image testing purposes only on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
